description.raw:
## Problem

When a `Scene3D` plugin is inserted, there's a chance a black box will appear around some item in the UI. Observations:

1. Sometimes there's no black box at all
1. When there is a black box, it's only one
1. The black box always appears around and is attached to one of these items:
    * plugin card

        ![black_card.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/3617105192-black_card.gif)

    * card's toolbar

        ![blackcardtb.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/2133830255-blackcardtb.png)

    * window toolbar
 
        ![blacktb.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/2437491727-blacktb.png)


## Solution

I'm hopeful that we may tweak what we're doing with OpenGL to eventually re-enable shadows. For now the solutions are to either:

1. Use a style other than material, for example:

        QT_QUICK_CONTROLS_STYLE=universal ign gui -v 4 -c ../examples/config/scene3d.config

1. Disable shadows for material, as this PR does


(FYI @iche033)
description.html:
Problem

When a Scene3D plugin is inserted, there's a chance a black box will appear around some item in the UI. Observations:

  1. Sometimes there's no black box at all
  2. When there is a black box, it's only one

  3. The black box always appears around and is attached to one of these items:

    • plugin card

    • card's toolbar

    • window toolbar

Solution

I'm hopeful that we may tweak what we're doing with OpenGL to eventually re-enable shadows. For now the solutions are to either:

  1. Use a style other than material, for example:

    QT_QUICK_CONTROLS_STYLE=universal ign gui -v 4 -c ../examples/config/scene3d.config

  2. Disable shadows for material, as this PR does

(FYI @iche033)

title.raw: [gz11] Disable material design shadows - interferes with Ogre
